info.title: Zallet
info.description: A prototype wallet. Don't rely on this for privacy or with significant funds yet!

methods.name: z_sendmany
methods.summary: Send a transaction with multiple recipients.
methods.description:
Send a transaction with multiple recipients.

This is an async operation; it returns an operation ID string that you can pass to
`z_getoperationstatus` or `z_getoperationresult`.

Amounts are decimal numbers with at most 8 digits of precision.

Change generated from one or more transparent addresses flows to a new transparent
address, while change generated from a legacy Sapling address returns to itself.
TODO: https://github.com/zcash/wallet/issues/138

When sending from a unified address, change is returned to the internal-only
address for the associated unified account.

When spending coinbase UTXOs, only shielded recipients are permitted and change is
not allowed; the entire value of the coinbase UTXO(s) must be consumed.
TODO: https://github.com/zcash/wallet/issues/137

# Arguments

- `fromaddress` (string, required) The transparent or shielded address to send the
  funds from. The following special strings are also accepted:
  - `"ANY_TADDR"`: Select non-coinbase UTXOs from any transparent addresses
    belonging to the wallet. Use `z_shieldcoinbase` to shield coinbase UTXOs from
    multiple transparent addresses.
  If a unified address is provided for this argument, the TXOs to be spent will be
  selected from those associated with the account corresponding to that unified
  address, from value pools corresponding to the receivers included in the UA.
- `amounts` (array, required) An array of JSON objects representing the amounts to
  send, with the following fields:
  - `address` (string, required) A taddr, zaddr, or Unified Address.
  - `amount` (numeric, required) The numeric amount in ZEC.
  - `memo` (string, optional) If the address is a zaddr, raw data represented in
    hexadecimal string format. If the output is being sent to a transparent
    address, it’s an error to include this field.
- `minconf` (numeric, optional) Only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
- `fee` (numeric, optional) If set, it must be null. Zallet always uses a fee
  calculated according to ZIP 317.
- `privacy_policy` (string, optional, default=`"FullPrivacy"`) Policy for what
  information leakage is acceptable. One of the following strings:
  - `"FullPrivacy"`: Only allow fully-shielded transactions (involving a single
    shielded value pool).
  - `"AllowRevealedAmounts"`: Allow funds to cross between shielded value pools,
    revealing the amount that crosses pools.
  - `"AllowRevealedRecipients"`: Allow transparent recipients. This also implies
    revealing information described under `"AllowRevealedAmounts"`.
  - `"AllowRevealedSenders"`: Allow transparent funds to be spent, revealing the
    sending addresses and amounts. This implies revealing information described
    under `"AllowRevealedAmounts"`.
  - `"AllowFullyTransparent"`: Allow transaction to both spend transparent funds
    and have transparent recipients. This implies revealing information described
    under `"AllowRevealedSenders"` and `"AllowRevealedRecipients"`.
  - `"AllowLinkingAccountAddresses"`: Allow selecting transparent coins from the
    full account, rather than just the funds sent to the transparent receiver in
    the provided Unified Address. This implies revealing information described
    under `"AllowRevealedSenders"`.
  - `"NoPrivacy"`: Allow the transaction to reveal any information necessary to
    create it. This implies revealing information described under
    `"AllowFullyTransparent"` and `"AllowLinkingAccountAddresses"`.

params.name: fromaddress
params.summary: The transparent or shielded address to send the funds from.
params.description: The transparent or shielded address to send the funds from.

params.name: amounts
params.summary: An array of JSON objects representing the amounts to send.
params.description: An array of JSON objects representing the amounts to send.

params.name: minconf
params.summary: Only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
params.description: Only use funds confirmed at least this many times.

params.name: fee
params.summary: If set, it must be null.
params.description: If set, it must be null.

params.name: privacy_policy
params.summary: Policy for what information leakage is acceptable.
params.description: Policy for what information leakage is acceptable.

methods.name: z_getaddressforaccount
methods.summary: For the given account, derives a Unified Address in accordance with the remaining
methods.description:
For the given account, derives a Unified Address in accordance with the remaining
arguments:

- If no list of receiver types is given (or the empty list `[]`), the best and
  second-best shielded receiver types, along with the "p2pkh" (i.e. transparent)
  receiver type, will be used.
- If no diversifier index is given, then:
  - If a transparent receiver would be included (either because no list of
    receiver types is given, or the provided list includes "p2pkh"), the next
    unused index (that is valid for the list of receiver types) will be selected.
  - If only shielded receivers would be included (because a list of receiver types
    is given that does not include "p2pkh"), a time-based index will be selected.

The account parameter must be a UUID or account number that was previously
generated by a call to the `z_getnewaccount` RPC method. The legacy account number
is only supported for wallets containing a single seed phrase.

Once a Unified Address has been derived at a specific diversifier index,
re-deriving it (via a subsequent call to `z_getaddressforaccount` with the same
account and index) will produce the same address with the same list of receiver
types. An error will be returned if a different list of receiver types is
requested, including when the empty list `[]` is provided (if the default receiver
types don't match).

params.name: account
params.summary: Either the UUID or ZIP 32 account index of the account to derive from.
params.description: Either the UUID or ZIP 32 account index of the account to derive from.

params.name: receiver_types
params.summary: Receiver types to include in the derived address.
params.description: Receiver types to include in the derived address.

params.name: diversifier_index
params.summary: A specific diversifier index to derive at.
params.description: A specific diversifier index to derive at.

result.name: z_getaddressforaccount_result
result.summary: Information about a derived Unified Address.
result.description: Information about a derived Unified Address.

methods.name: z_gettotalbalance
methods.summary: Returns the total value of funds stored in the node's wallet.
methods.description:
Returns the total value of funds stored in the node's wallet.

TODO: Currently watchonly addresses cannot be omitted; `include_watchonly` must be
set to true.

# Arguments

- `minconf` (numeric, optional, default=1) Only include private and transparent
  transactions confirmed at least this many times.
- `include_watchonly` (bool, optional, default=false) Also include balance in
  watchonly addresses (see 'importaddress' and 'z_importviewingkey').

params.name: minconf
params.summary: Only include notes in transactions confirmed at least this many times.
params.description: Only include notes in transactions confirmed at least this many times.

params.name: include_watchonly
params.summary: Also include balance in watchonly addresses.
params.description: Also include balance in watchonly addresses.

result.name: z_gettotalbalance_result
result.summary: The total value of funds stored in the wallet.
result.description: The total value of funds stored in the wallet.

methods.name: walletlock
methods.summary: Removes the wallet encryption key from memory, locking the wallet.
methods.description:
Removes the wallet encryption key from memory, locking the wallet.

After calling this method, you will need to call `walletpassphrase` again before
being able to call any methods which require the wallet to be unlocked.

methods.name: z_getnewaccount
methods.summary: Prepares and returns a new account.
methods.description:
Prepares and returns a new account.

If the wallet contains more than one UA-compatible HD seed phrase, the `seedfp`
argument must be provided. Available seed fingerprints can be found in the output
of the `listaddresses` RPC method.

Within a UA-compatible HD seed phrase, accounts are numbered starting from zero;
this RPC method selects the next available sequential account number.

Each new account is a separate group of funds within the wallet, and adds an
additional performance cost to wallet scanning.

Use the `z_getaddressforaccount` RPC method to obtain addresses for an account.

params.name: account_name
params.summary: A human-readable name for the account.
params.description: A human-readable name for the account.

params.name: seedfp
params.summary: ZIP 32 seed fingerprint for the BIP 39 mnemonic phrase from which to derive the account.
params.description: ZIP 32 seed fingerprint for the BIP 39 mnemonic phrase from which to derive the account.

methods.name: help
methods.summary: List all commands, or get help for a specified command.
methods.description:
List all commands, or get help for a specified command.

# Arguments
- `command` (string, optional) The command to get help on.

params.name: command
params.summary: The command to get help on.
params.description: The command to get help on.

methods.name: stop
methods.summary: Stop the running zallet process.
methods.description:
Stop the running zallet process.

# Notes

- Works for non windows targets only.
- Works only if the network of the running zallet process is `Regtest`.

methods.name: z_getoperationresult
methods.summary: Retrieve the result and status of an operation which has finished, and then remove
methods.description:
Retrieve the result and status of an operation which has finished, and then remove
the operation from memory.

- If the operation has failed, it will include an error object.
- If the operation has succeeded, it will include the result value.
- If the operation was cancelled, there will be no error object or result value.

# Arguments
- `operationid` (array, optional) A list of operation ids we are interested in.
  If not provided, retrieve all finished operations known to the node.

params.name: operationid
params.summary: A list of operation ids we are interested in.
params.description: A list of operation ids we are interested in.

methods.name: z_getoperationstatus
methods.summary: Get operation status and any associated result or error data.
methods.description:
Get operation status and any associated result or error data.

The operation will remain in memory.

- If the operation has failed, it will include an error object.
- If the operation has succeeded, it will include the result value.
- If the operation was cancelled, there will be no error object or result value.

# Arguments
- `operationid` (array, optional) A list of operation ids we are interested in.
  If not provided, examine all operations known to the node.

params.name: operationid
params.summary: A list of operation ids we are interested in.
params.description: A list of operation ids we are interested in.

methods.name: z_viewtransaction
methods.summary: Returns detailed information about in-wallet transaction `txid`.
methods.description:
Returns detailed information about in-wallet transaction `txid`.

This method returns information about spends and outputs within the transaction
that are visible to the wallet. Importantly, this does not include information
about spent notes that are not controlled by spending or viewing keys in the
wallet, and so callers MUST NOT use the `spends` or `outputs` fields to compute
balances or fees themselves. Use the provided `accounts` and `fee` fields instead.

params.name: txid
params.summary: The ID of the transaction to view.
params.description: The ID of the transaction to view.

result.name: z_viewtransaction_result
result.summary: Detailed information about an in-wallet transaction.
result.description: Detailed information about an in-wallet transaction.

methods.name: walletpassphrase
methods.summary: Stores the wallet decryption key in memory for `timeout` seconds.
methods.description:
Stores the wallet decryption key in memory for `timeout` seconds.

If the wallet is locked, this API must be invoked prior to performing operations
that require the availability of private keys, such as sending funds.

Issuing the `walletpassphrase` command while the wallet is already unlocked will
set a new unlock time that overrides the old one.

params.name: passphrase
params.summary: The passphrase for decrypting the wallet's age identity.
params.description: The passphrase for decrypting the wallet's age identity.

params.name: timeout
params.summary: Time in seconds after which the wallet will relock.
params.description: Time in seconds after which the wallet will relock.

methods.name: z_listtransactions
methods.summary: Returns a list of the wallet's transactions, optionally filtered by account and block
methods.description:
Returns a list of the wallet's transactions, optionally filtered by account and block
range.

# Arguments
- `account_uuid`: The UUID of the wallet account. If omitted, return transactions for all
  accounts in the wallet.
- `start_height`: The inclusive lower bound of block heights for which transactions mined
  in those blocks should be returned. If omitted, the start height will default to the
  account birthday height if an account UUID is specified, or the minimum birthday
  height among accounts in the wallet if no account is specified.
- `end_height`: The exclusive upper bound of block heights for which transactions mined
  in those blocks should be returned. If omitted, return all transactions mined or created
  above the start height.
- `offset`: An optional number of transactions to skip over before a page of results is
  returned. Defaults to zero.
- `limit`: An optional upper bound on the number of results that should be returned in a
  page.  

WARNING: This is currently an experimental feature; arguments and result data may change at
any time.

params.name: account_uuid
params.summary: The UUID of the account to list transactions for.
params.description: The UUID of the account to list transactions for.

params.name: start_height
params.summary: The (inclusive) lower bound on block heights for which transactions should be retrieved
params.description: The (inclusive) lower bound on block heights for which transactions should be retrieved

params.name: end_height
params.summary: The (exclusive) upper bound on block heights for which transactions should be retrieved
params.description: The (exclusive) upper bound on block heights for which transactions should be retrieved

params.name: offset
params.summary: The number of results to skip before returning a page of results.
params.description: The number of results to skip before returning a page of results.

params.name: limit
params.summary: The maximum number of results to return from a single call.
params.description: The maximum number of results to return from a single call.

result.name: z_listtransactions_result
result.summary: A list of transactions involving the wallet.
result.description: A list of transactions involving the wallet.

methods.name: getwalletinfo
methods.summary: Returns wallet state information.
methods.description: Returns wallet state information.

methods.name: z_getnotescount
methods.summary: Returns the number of notes available in the wallet for each shielded value pool.
methods.description:
Returns the number of notes available in the wallet for each shielded value pool.

# Arguments
- `minconf`: Only include notes in transactions confirmed at least this many times
  (default = 1). Must be at least 1 when `as_of_height` is provided.
- `as_of_height`: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height
  specified by this argument. The default is to use the entire blockchain that the node is
  aware of. -1 can be used as in other RPC calls to indicate the current height (including
  the mempool), but this does not support negative values in general. A “future” height will
  fall back to the current height.

params.name: minconf
params.summary: Only include notes in transactions confirmed at least this many times.
params.description: Only include notes in transactions confirmed at least this many times.

params.name: as_of_height
params.summary: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height specified by this argument.
params.description: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height specified by this argument.

result.name: z_getnotescount_result
result.summary: The number of notes in the wallet.
result.description: The number of notes in the wallet.

methods.name: z_listunifiedreceivers
methods.summary: Returns a record of the individual receivers contained within the provided UA,
methods.description:
Returns a record of the individual receivers contained within the provided UA,
keyed by receiver type. The UA may not have receivers for some receiver types,
in which case those keys will be absent.

Transactions that send funds to any of the receivers returned by this RPC
method will be detected by the wallet as having been sent to the unified
address.

# Arguments
- `unified_address` (string, required) The unified address to inspect.

params.name: unified_address
params.summary: The unified address to inspect.
params.description: The unified address to inspect.

result.name: z_listunifiedreceivers_result
result.summary: The receivers within a unified address.
result.description: The receivers within a unified address.

methods.name: z_listoperationids
methods.summary: Returns the list of operation ids currently known to the wallet.
methods.description:
Returns the list of operation ids currently known to the wallet.

# Arguments
- `status` (string, optional) Filter result by the operation's state e.g. "success".

params.name: status
params.summary: Filter result by the operation's state e.g. "success".
params.description: Filter result by the operation's state e.g. "success".

methods.name: z_listunspent
methods.summary: Returns an array of unspent shielded notes with between minconf and maxconf
methods.description:
Returns an array of unspent shielded notes with between minconf and maxconf
(inclusive) confirmations.

Results may be optionally filtered to only include notes sent to specified
addresses. When `minconf` is 0, unspent notes with zero confirmations are
returned, even though they are not immediately spendable.

# Arguments
- `minconf`: Select outputs with at least this many confirmations (default = 1). Must be at
  least 1 when `as_of_height` is provided.
- `maxconf`: Select outputs with at most this many confirmations (default = unlimited).
- `include_watchonly`: Include notes/utxos for which the wallet does not provide spending
  capability (default = false).
- `addresses`: A list of addresses for which to retrieve UTXOs. For shielded addresses that
  correspond to a unified account, unspent notes belonging to that account are returned
  irrespective of whether the provided address's diversifier corresponds to the diversifier
  of the address that received the funds. If this parameter is omitted or empty, all notes
  are returned, irrespective of account. (default = None)
- `as_of_height`: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height
  specified by this argument. The default is to use the entire blockchain that the node is
  aware of. -1 can be used as in other RPC calls to indicate the current height (including
  the mempool), but this does not support negative values in general. A “future” height will
  fall back to the current height.

params.name: minconf
params.summary: Only include outputs of transactions confirmed at least this many times.
params.description: Only include outputs of transactions confirmed at least this many times.

params.name: maxconf
params.summary: Only include outputs of transactions confirmed at most this many times.
params.description: Only include outputs of transactions confirmed at most this many times.

params.name: include_watchonly
params.summary: Also include outputs received at watch-only addresses.
params.description: Also include outputs received at watch-only addresses.

params.name: addresses
params.summary: If non-empty, only outputs received by the provided addresses will be returned.
params.description: If non-empty, only outputs received by the provided addresses will be returned.

params.name: as_of_height
params.summary: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height specified by this argument.
params.description: Execute the query as if it were run when the blockchain was at the height specified by this argument.

methods.name: z_recoveraccounts
methods.summary: Tells the wallet to track specific accounts.
methods.description:
Tells the wallet to track specific accounts.

Returns the UUIDs within this Zallet instance of the newly-tracked accounts.
Accounts that are already tracked by the wallet are ignored.

After calling this method, a subsequent call to `z_getnewaccount` will add the
first account with index greater than all indices provided here for the
corresponding `seedfp` (as well as any already tracked by the wallet).

Each tracked account is a separate group of funds within the wallet, and adds an
additional performance cost to wallet scanning.

Use the `z_getaddressforaccount` RPC method to obtain addresses for an account.

# Arguments

- `accounts` (array, required) An array of JSON objects representing the accounts
  to recover, with the following fields:
  - `name` (string, required)
  - `seedfp` (string, required) The seed fingerprint for the mnemonic phrase from
    which the account is derived. Available seed fingerprints can be found in the
    output of the `listaddresses` RPC method.
  - `zip32_account_index` (numeric, required)
  - `birthday_height` (numeric, required)

params.name: accounts
params.summary: An array of JSON objects representing the accounts to recover.
params.description: An array of JSON objects representing the accounts to recover.

methods.name: getrawtransaction
methods.summary: Returns the raw transaction data for the given transaction ID.
methods.description:
Returns the raw transaction data for the given transaction ID.

NOTE: If `blockhash` is provided, only that block will be searched, and if the
transaction is in the mempool or other blocks, or if the node backing this wallet
does not have the given block available, the transaction will not be found.

# Arguments
- `txid` (string, required) The transaction ID.
- `verbose` (numeric, optional, default=0) If 0, return a string of hex-encoded
  data. If non-zero, return a JSON object with information about `txid`.
- `blockhash` (string, optional) The block in which to look for the transaction.

params.name: txid
params.summary: The ID of the transaction to fetch.
params.description: The ID of the transaction to fetch.

params.name: verbose
params.summary: If 0, return a string of hex-encoded data. If non-zero, return a JSON object with information about `txid`
params.description: If 0, return a string of hex-encoded data. If non-zero, return a JSON object with information about `txid`

params.name: blockhash
params.summary: The block in which to look for the transaction.
params.description: The block in which to look for the transaction.

methods.name: rpc.discover
methods.summary: Returns an OpenRPC schema as a description of this service.
methods.description: Returns an OpenRPC schema as a description of this service.

methods.name: listaddresses
methods.summary: Lists the addresses managed by this wallet by source.
methods.description:
Lists the addresses managed by this wallet by source.

Sources include:
- Addresses generated from randomness by a legacy `zcashd` wallet.
- Sapling addresses generated from the legacy `zcashd` HD seed.
- Imported watchonly transparent addresses.
- Shielded addresses tracked using imported viewing keys.
- Addresses derived from mnemonic seed phrases.

In the case that a source does not have addresses for a value pool, the key
associated with that pool will be absent.

REMINDER: It is recommended that you back up your wallet files regularly. If you
have not imported externally-produced keys, it only necessary to have backed up
the wallet's key storage file.

address.description: A taddr, zaddr, or Unified Address.

memo.description:
If the address is a zaddr, raw data represented in hexadecimal string format. If
the output is being sent to a transparent address, it’s an error to include this
field.

account_uuid.description: The account's UUID within this Zallet instance.

diversifier_index.description: The diversifier index specified or chosen.

receiver_types.description: The receiver types that the UA contains (valid values are "p2pkh", "sapling", "orchard").

address.description: The unified address corresponding to the diversifier.

Address.description: Information about a derived Unified Address.

transparent.description: The total value of unspent transparent outputs, in ZEC

private.description: The total value of unspent Sapling and Orchard outputs, in ZEC

total.description: The total value of unspent shielded and transparent outputs, in ZEC

TotalBalance.description: The total value of funds stored in the wallet.

account_uuid.description: The new account's UUID within this Zallet instance.

account.description: The new account's ZIP 32 account index.

OperationStatus.description: The status of an async operation.

OperationState.description: The possible states that an async operation can be in.

status.description:
The transaction status.

One of 'mined', 'waiting', 'expiringsoon' or 'expired'.

confirmations.description:
The number of confirmations.

- A positive value is the number of blocks that have been mined including the
  transaction in the chain. For example, 1 confirmation means the transaction is
  in the block currently at the chain tip.
- 0 means the transaction is in the mempool. If `asOfHeight` was set, this case
  will not occur.
- -1 means the transaction cannot be mined.

blockhash.description:
The hash of the main chain block that this transaction is mined in.

Omitted if this transaction is not mined within a block in the current best chain.

blockindex.description:
The index of the transaction within its block's `vtx` field.

Omitted if this transaction is not mined within a block in the current best chain.

blocktime.description:
The time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT) that the main chain block
containing this transaction was mined.

Omitted if this transaction is not mined within a block in the current best chain.

expiryheight.description:
The greatest height at which this transaction can be mined, or 0 if this
transaction does not expire.

fee.description:
The fee paid by the transaction.

Omitted if this is a coinbase transaction, or if the fee cannot be determined
because one or more transparent inputs of the transaction cannot be found.

generated.description: Set to `true` if this is a coinbase transaction, omitted otherwise.

spends.description: The inputs to the transaction that the wallet is capable of viewing.

outputs.description: The outputs of the transaction that the wallet is capable of viewing.

accounts.description: A map from an involved account's UUID to the effects of this transaction on it.

Transaction.description: Detailed information about an in-wallet transaction.

tIn.description: (transparent) the index of the spend within `vin`.

spend.description: (sapling) the index of the spend within `vShieldedSpend`.

action.description: (orchard) the index of the action within orchard bundle.

txidPrev.description: The id for the transaction this note was created in.

tOutPrev.description:
(transparent) the index of the corresponding output within the previous
transaction's `vout`.

outputPrev.description:
(sapling) the index of the corresponding output within the previous transaction's
`vShieldedOutput`.

actionPrev.description:
(orchard) the index of the corresponding action within the previous transaction's
Orchard bundle.

account_uuid.description:
The UUID of the Zallet account that received the corresponding output.

Omitted if the output is not for an account in the wallet (which always means that
`pool` is `"transparent"`; external shielded spends are never included because
they are unviewable).

address.description:
The Zcash address involved in the transaction.

Omitted if this note was received on an account-internal address (e.g. change
notes).

tOut.description: (transparent) the index of the output within the `vout`.

output.description: (sapling) the index of the output within the `vShieldedOutput`.

action.description: (orchard) the index of the action within the orchard bundle.

account_uuid.description:
The UUID of the Zallet account that received the output.

Omitted if the output is not for an account in the wallet (`outgoing = true`).

address.description:
The Zcash address that received the output.

Omitted if this output was received on an account-internal address (e.g. change outputs),
or is a transparent output to a script that is not either P2PKH or P2SH (and thus doesn't
have an address encoding).

outgoing.description: `true` if the output is not for an address in the wallet.

walletInternal.description:
`true` if the output was received by the account's internal viewing key.

The `address` field is guaranteed be absent when this field is set to `true`, in which case
it indicates that this may be a change output, an output of a wallet-internal shielding
transaction, an output of a wallet-internal cross-account transfer, or otherwise is the
result of some wallet-internal operation.

value.description: The value of the output in ZEC.

valueZat.description: The value of the output in zatoshis.

memo.description:
Hexadecimal string representation of the memo field.

Omitted if this is a transparent output.

memoStr.description:
UTF-8 string representation of memo field (if it contains valid UTF-8).

Omitted if this is a transparent output.

delta.description:
The net change of the account's balance, in ZEC.

This includes any contribution by this account to the transaction fee.

deltaZat.description:
The net change of the account's balance, in zatoshis.

This includes any contribution by this account to the transaction fee.

AccountEffect.description: The effect of a transaction on an account's balance.

ResultType6.description: A list of transactions involving the wallet.

account_uuid.description:
The UUID of the account that this transaction entry is acting on.

A transaction that has effects on multiple accounts will have multiple rows in the result.

mined_height.description: The height at which the transaction was mined

expiry_height.description: The expiry height of the transaction

account_balance_delta.description: The delta to the account produced by the transaction

fee_paid.description: The fee paid by the transaction, if known.

sent_note_count.description: The number of outputs produced by the transaction.

received_note_count.description: The number of outputs received by the transaction.

block_time.description: The timestamp at which the block was mined.

block_datetime.description: The human-readable datetime at which the block was mined.

expired_unmined.description: Whether or not the transaction expired without having been mined.

outputs.description: The outputs of the transaction received by the wallet.

WalletTx.description: A transaction that affects an account in a wallet.

WalletTxOutput.description:
Basic information about a transaction output that was either created or received by this
wallet.

account_uuid.description: The account's UUID within this Zallet instance.

diversifier_index.description: A diversifier index used in the account.

ua.description: The unified address corresponding to the diversifier.

walletversion.description: The wallet version, in its "Bitcoin client version" form.

balance.description: The total confirmed transparent balance of the wallet in ZEC.

unconfirmed_balance.description:
The total unconfirmed transparent balance of the wallet in ZEC.

Not included if `asOfHeight` is specified.

immature_balance.description: The total immature transparent balance of the wallet in ZEC.

shielded_balance.description: The total confirmed shielded balance of the wallet in ZEC.

shielded_unconfirmed_balance.description:
The total unconfirmed shielded balance of the wallet in ZEC.

Not included if `asOfHeight` is specified.

txcount.description: The total number of transactions in the wallet

keypoololdest.description:
The timestamp (seconds since GMT epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the
key pool.

keypoolsize.description: How many new keys are pre-generated.

unlocked_until.description:
The timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is
unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked.

mnemonic_seedfp.description: The BLAKE2b-256 hash of the HD seed derived from the wallet's emergency recovery phrase.

sprout.description:
The number of Sprout notes in the wallet.

Always zero, because Sprout is not supported.

sapling.description: The number of Sapling notes in the wallet.

orchard.description: The number of Orchard notes in the wallet.

GetNotesCount.description: The number of notes in the wallet.

p2pkh.description:
The legacy P2PKH transparent address.

Omitted if `p2sh` is present.

p2sh.description:
The legacy P2SH transparent address.

Omitted if `p2pkh` is present.

orchard.description: A single-receiver Unified Address containing the Orchard receiver.

ListUnifiedReceivers.description: The receivers within a unified address.

txid.description: The ID of the transaction that created this output.

pool.description:
The shielded value pool.

One of `["sapling", "orchard", "transparent"]`.

outindex.description: The Transparent UTXO, Sapling output or Orchard action index.

is_watch_only.description: `true` if the account that received the output is watch-only

address.description:
The Zcash address that received the output.

Omitted if this output was received on an account-internal address (for example, change
and shielding outputs).

account_uuid.description: The UUID of the wallet account that received this output.

walletInternal.description:
`true` if the output was received by the account's internal viewing key.

The `address` field is guaranteed be absent when this field is set to `true`, in which case
it indicates that this may be a change output, an output of a wallet-internal shielding
transaction, an output of a wallet-internal cross-account transfer, or otherwise is the
result of some wallet-internal operation.

value.description: The value of the output in ZEC.

valueZat.description: The value of the output in zatoshis.

memo.description:
Hexadecimal string representation of the memo field.

Omitted if this is a transparent output.

memoStr.description: UTF-8 string representation of memo field (if it contains valid UTF-8).

account_uuid.description: The account's UUID within this Zallet instance.

anyOf.description: An object describing the transaction in detail.

in_active_chain.description:
Whether specified block is in the active chain or not.

Only present with explicit `blockhash` argument.

hex.description: The serialized, hex-encoded data for the transaction identified by `txid`.

authdigest.description:
The transaction's authorizing data commitment.

For pre-v5 transactions this will be `ffff..ffff`.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string to match `txid`.

versiongroupid.description:
The version group ID.

Omitted if `overwintered` is `false`.

expiryheight.description:
The block height after which the transaction expires.

Omitted if `overwintered` is `false`.

vin.description: The transparent inputs to the transaction.

vout.description: The transparent outputs from the transaction.

valueBalance.description:
The net value of Sapling Spends minus Outputs in ZEC.

Omitted if `version < 4`.

valueBalanceZat.description:
The net value of Sapling Spends minus Outputs in zatoshis.

Omitted if `version < 4`.

bindingSig.description:
The Sapling binding signature, encoded as a hex string.

Omitted if `version < 4`, or both `vShieldedSpend` and `vShieldedOutput` are empty.

orchard.description:
JSON object with Orchard-specific information.

Omitted if `version < 5`.

blockhash.description:
The hash of the block that the transaction is mined in, if any.

Omitted if the transaction is not known to be mined in any block.

height.description:
The height of the block that the transaction is mined in, or -1 if that block is
not in the current best chain.

Omitted if `blockhash` is either omitted or unknown.

confirmations.description:
The number of confirmations the transaction has, or 0 if the block it is mined in
is not in the current best chain.

Omitted if `blockhash` is either omitted or unknown.

time.description:
The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT).

This is always identical to `blocktime`.

Omitted if `blockhash` is either omitted or not in the current best chain.

blocktime.description:
The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) for the block that the
transaction is mined in.

Omitted if `blockhash` is either omitted or not in the current best chain.

coinbase.description:
The coinbase `scriptSig`, encoded as a hex string.

Omitted if this is not a coinbase transaction.

txid.description:
The transaction ID of the output being spent.

Omitted if this is a coinbase transaction.

vout.description:
The index of the output being spent within the transaction identified by `txid`.

Omitted if this is a coinbase transaction.

scriptSig.description: Omitted if this is a coinbase transaction.

asm.description: The assembly string representation of the script.

hex.description: The serialized script, encoded as a hex string.

n.description: The index of the output within the transaction's `vout` field.

asm.description: The assembly string representation of the script.

hex.description: The serialized script, encoded as a hex string.

reqSigs.description: The required number of signatures to spend this output.

type.description:
The type of script.

One of `["pubkey", "pubkeyhash", "scripthash", "multisig", "nulldata", "nonstandard"]`.

addresses.description: Array of the transparent P2PKH addresses involved in the script.

cv.description:
Value commitment to the input note.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

anchor.description:
Merkle root of the Sapling note commitment tree.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

nullifier.description:
The nullifier of the input note.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

rk.description:
The randomized public key for `spendAuthSig`.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

proof.description: A zero-knowledge proof using the Sapling Spend circuit, encoded as a hex string.

spendAuthSig.description: A signature authorizing this Spend, encoded as a hex string.

cv.description:
Value commitment to the output note.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

cmu.description:
The u-coordinate of the note commitment for the output note.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

ephemeralKey.description:
A Jubjub public key.

Encoded as a byte-reversed hex string for legacy reasons.

encCiphertext.description: The output note encrypted to the recipient, encoded as a hex string.

outCiphertext.description:
A ciphertext enabling the sender to recover the output note, encoded as a hex
string.

proof.description: A zero-knowledge proof using the Sapling Output circuit, encoded as a hex string.

actions.description: The Orchard Actions for the transaction.

valueBalance.description: The net value of Orchard Actions in ZEC.

valueBalanceZat.description: The net value of Orchard Actions in zatoshis.

flags.description:
The Orchard bundle flags.

Omitted if `actions` is empty.

anchor.description:
A root of the Orchard note commitment tree at some block height in the past,
encoded as a hex string.

Omitted if `actions` is empty.

proof.description:
Encoding of aggregated zk-SNARK proofs for Orchard Actions, encoded as a hex
string.

Omitted if `actions` is empty.

bindingSig.description:
An Orchard binding signature on the SIGHASH transaction hash, encoded as a hex
string.

Omitted if `actions` is empty.

cv.description:
A value commitment to the net value of the input note minus the output note,
encoded as a hex string.

nullifier.description: The nullifier of the input note, encoded as a hex string.

rk.description: The randomized validating key for `spendAuthSig`, encoded as a hex string.

cmx.description:
The x-coordinate of the note commitment for the output note, encoded as a hex
string.

ephemeralKey.description: An encoding of an ephemeral Pallas public key, encoded as a hex string.

encCiphertext.description: The output note encrypted to the recipient, encoded as a hex string.

outCiphertext.description:
A ciphertext enabling the sender to recover the output note, encoded as a hex
string.

spendAuthSig.description: A signature authorizing the spend in this Action, encoded as a hex string.

enableSpends.description: Whether spends are enabled in this Orchard bundle.

enableOutputs.description: Whether outputs are enabled in this Orchard bundle.

transparent.description:
This object contains transparent addresses for which we have no derivation
information.

derived_transparent.description:
Each element in this list represents a set of transparent addresses derived from a
single BIP 44 account index.

sapling.description:
Each element in this list represents a set of diversified addresses derived from a
single IVK.

unified.description:
Each element in this list represents a set of diversified Unified Addresses
derived from a single UFVK.

diversifier_index.description: The diversifier index that the UA was derived at.

receiver_types.description: The receiver types that the UA contains (valid values are "p2pkh", "sapling", "orchard").

address.description: The unified address corresponding to the diversifier.
